com.fluidops.iwb.api
Interface ReadWriteDataManager

All Superinterfaces:
ReadDataManager
All Known Implementing Classes:
ReadWriteDataManagerImpl
public interface ReadWriteDataManager
extends ReadDataManager

Extension of the ReadDataManager providing additional methods for write-access to database. In contrast to the ReadDataManager, it does not support the method getDataManager(), but instead openDataManager() (and it must be closed again when finished). This is because we want to forbid connection sharing for write-access to the database.

Author:
msc

Method Detail

close

void close()
Closes the data manager by closing the inner connection. Should always be called (the finalize method tries this, too, but we actually don't know when it is called).

loadData

Context loadData(org.openrdf.model.URI src,
                 org.openrdf.model.URI group,
                 Context.ContextType contextType,
                 Context.ContextLabel label,
                 org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat format,
                 java.io.File f)
Loads data for the source from a file. Data is written to a fresh context. More precisely, the method creates a fresh context for the src and writes data into this context. Other contexts of the given source are left unmodified. The context meta data is persisted internally.

Parameters:
src - URI of the src
group - URI of the context group
contextType - type of the context
label - label of the context
format - file format
f - the file from which to load data
Returns:
the (fresh) context in which data has been loaded

Parameters:
src - URI of the src
contextType - type of the context
label - label of the context
stmts - the statements to load
Returns:
the (fresh) context in which data has been loaded

sparqlUpdate

void sparqlUpdate(java.lang.String query,
                  org.openrdf.model.Value resolveValue,
                  boolean infer,
                  Context context)
                  throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                         org.openrdf.query.UpdateExecutionException
Perform a SPARQL 1.1 update operation, i.e. DELETE or UPDATE. Internally namespace prefixes are replaced. An (optional) context can be provided, in which all metadata is persisted (iff triples have been added to the context). This context is also used to replace the special variable $usercontext$ within the query string. Note that a context must be given, if the query string contains $usercontext$ (otherwise you will run into IllegalArgumentExceptions)

Parameters:
query -
resolveValue - the value used for ??
infer -
context - the context to be used for metadata or null
Throws:
org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
org.openrdf.query.UpdateExecutionException

importRDFfromInputStream

void importRDFfromInputStream(java.io.InputStream input,
                              java.lang.String baseURI,
                              org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat dataFormat,
                              Context targetContext)
Imports rdf data from an input stream into the global repository. Data is written to the provided context. If the provided context is null, a fresh user context is generated.

Parameters:
InputStream - input as the source of the data to import
String - baseURI as the base URI for resolving relative URIs
RDFFormat - dataFormat, the format of the source data (N3 , NTRIPLES, RDFXML, TRIG, TURTLE)
targetContext - context to use, can be null

importRDFfromInputStream

                              java.lang.String baseURI,
                              org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat rdfFormat)
Imports RDF data from an input stream that is filled from a TRIG source. Data is imported as is, i.e. no contexts are generated. No VOID statistics are calculated.

Parameters:
input -
baseURI -

updateDataForSrc

Context updateDataForSrc(org.openrdf.model.URI src,
                         org.openrdf.model.URI providerParam,
                         Context.ContextType contextType,
                         Context.ContextLabel label,
                         java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                         java.lang.Long contextExpirationDateMS)
Loads data for the source from a file and removes all data older than contextExpirationDateMS. If contextExpirationDateMS is zero, all previous data is deleted. Data is written to a fresh context. More precisely, the method creates a fresh context for the src and writes data into this context. Other contexts of the given source are left unmodified. The context meta data is persisted internally.

Parameters:
src - URI of the src
providerParam -
contextType - type of the context
label - Name for the context
stmts - The list of stmts to write
f - the file from which to load data
contextExpirationDateMS - the date after which the context expires
Returns:
the (fresh) context in which data has been loaded

                         org.openrdf.model.URI providerParam,
                         Context.ContextType contextType,
                         Context.ContextLabel label,
                         org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat format,
                         java.io.File f,
                         java.lang.Long contextExpirationDateMS)
Loads data for the source from a file and removes all data older than contextExpirationDateMS. If contextExpirationDateMS is zero, all previous data is deleted. Data is written to a fresh context. More precisely, the method creates a fresh context for the src and writes data into this context. Other contexts of the given source are left unmodified. The context meta data is persisted internally.

Parameters:

format - file format
f - the file from which to load data

Returns:
the (fresh) context in which data has been loaded

updateDataForGroup

void updateDataForGroup(org.openrdf.model.URI source,
                        org.openrdf.model.URI group,
                        org.openrdf.model.URI providerParam,
                        Context.ContextType contextType,
                        Context.ContextLabel label,
                        java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                        java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.URI> omitContexts,
                        java.lang.Long contextExpirationDateMS)
Loads data for the source from a file and removes all data older than contextExpirationDateMS from the given context group (must not be null). If contextExpirationDateMS is zero, all previous data is deleted. Data is written to a fresh context. More precisely, the method creates a fresh context for the src and writes data into this context. Other contexts of the given source are left unmodified. The context meta data is persisted internally.

Parameters:
source - the identifier of the source that writes the data
group - the group to which the generated context belongs
providerParam -
contextType - the context type
label - describing the context content
stmts - list of stmts to write in new context
omitContexts - list of source identifiers whose contexts should be omitted from deletion
contextExpirationDateMS - date for context expiration

addToContext

void addToContext(org.openrdf.model.Statement stmt,
                  Context context)
Adds the triple to the specified context. Does not check for duplicates, i.e. also adds the triple if it is already contained in another context.

addToContext

void addToContext(java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                  Context context)
Adds the triples to the specified context. Does not check for duplicates, i.e. also adds the triples if they are already contained in another context. Context must not be null.

addToContextWithoutPersist

void addToContextWithoutPersist(java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                                Context context)
Adds the triples to the specified context but does not persist the context meta information, i.e. persistance of meta information must be handled outside. This is useful if a lot of individual requests write to the context, and there is no need to update the context meta information on each request. Does not check for duplicates, i.e. also adds the triples if they are already contained in another context. Context must not be null.

addToContext

void addToContext(java.io.File f,
                  org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat rdfFormat,
                  Context context)
Loads file content into the specified context. Does not check for duplicates, i.e. also adds the triples if they are already contained in another context. Context must not be null.

                  Context context)
Loads statements into the specified context. Does not check for duplicates, i.e. also adds the triples if they are already contained in another context. Context must not be null.

                              Context context)
Adds the triples to the context while checking for duplicates, i.e. adds only those triples that are not already contained in another context. Context must not be null.

removeInUserContexts

java.util.Set<org.openrdf.model.URI> removeInUserContexts(org.openrdf.model.Statement stmt,
                                                          Context changeLog)
Removes matching statements from user contexts, independently from the context specified in the statement. In addition, if the statement's object is a literal, the datatype will be ignored when deleting, i.e. all statements with same subject, predicate and /object label/ will be deleted.

Parameters:
stmt - the statement to delete
Returns:
the set of modified contexts

                                                          Context changeLog)
Removes matching statements from user contexts, independently from the context specified in the statement. In addition, if a statement's object is a literal, the datatype will be ignored when deleting, i.e. all statements with same subject, predicate and /object label/ will be deleted.

Parameters:
stmts - collection of statements to delete

Parameters:

removeInSpecifiedContext

java.util.Set<org.openrdf.model.URI> removeInSpecifiedContext(org.openrdf.model.Statement stmt,
                                                              Context changeLog)
Removes statement from the context specified in the statements. If no context is specified, the statement will be deleted in all contexts. Performs context cleanup for contexts that have become empty.

Parameters:
stmts - list of statement to delete
context - the context of the delete operation

                                                               Context changeLog)
Removes statements from the contexts specified in the statements. If no context is specified, the statement will be deleted in all contexts. Performs context cleanup for contexts that have become empty.

removeStmtsFromGroup

void removeStmtsFromGroup(java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                          org.openrdf.model.URI group,
                          java.util.Set<org.openrdf.model.URI> updatedContexts)
Removes matching statements from all context associated to source that has associated the given group (if the group is null, nothing will happen). In contrast to the removeDate method, this method simply removes the statements "as is" from the contexts and does not have special handling for differences in data types. If you pass a parameter updatedContexts!=null, then the method will fill it with all contexts that have been updated, but NOT cleanup empty contexts automatically (this is very useful to optimize batch operations); if updateContexts==null, then the method will handle context updated internally.

Parameters:
stmts - list of statements to delete
source - the owner's source
updatedContexts -

deleteContextById

void deleteContextById(org.openrdf.model.Resource contextId)
Delete context meta information and all contained triples. If the contextId is null, nothing will be deleted. If it is not an IWB-internal context, only the data in the context is deleted.

Parameters:
contextId - URI/resource of the context

deleteExpiredContextsOfSource

void deleteExpiredContextsOfSource(org.openrdf.model.URI source,
                                   org.openrdf.model.URI inputParameter,
                                   java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.Resource> omitContexts,
                                   java.lang.Long expirationTimeMS)
Delete all outdated contexts and context meta information of src. If src is null, nothing happens. The omitContexts parameter can be used to list contexts that are excluded from removal (you may also pass null).

Parameters:
source - the source whose contexts are to be retrieved
inputParameter - URI of context to delete
omitContexts - URIs of contexts to omit
expirationTimeMS - the time (in ms) after which a context is considered invalid (null means all contexts are outdated)

deleteExpiredContextsOfGroup

void deleteExpiredContextsOfGroup(org.openrdf.model.URI group,
                                  java.util.Collection<org.openrdf.model.URI> omitContexts,
                                  java.lang.Long expirationTimeMS)
Delete all outdated contexts and context meta information of group. If group is null, nothing happens. The omitContexts parameter can be used to list contexts (source identifier) that are excluded from removal (you may also pass null).

Parameters:
group - the group whose contexts to delete
omitContexts - URIs of source identifiers whose contexts should be ommitted from deleted
expirationTimeMS - the time (in ms) after which a context is considered invalid (null means all contexts are outdated)

deleteVoIDStatisticsOfContext

void deleteVoIDStatisticsOfContext(org.openrdf.model.Resource resource)
Delete all VoID statistics of a given context. Do this by recursively searching and deleting all triples related to this context.

Parameters:
resource - During the first invocation, this is the resource (context) to which VoID statistics are attached. In later invocations this is a subject for which is checked, if it has other outgoing statements which need to be deleted.

replaceRepositoryContent

void replaceRepositoryContent(java.io.File f,
                              org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat format)
Fully replaces the current repository content with the content from the file. All content currently residing in the repository will be irreversibly lost. Can be used for restore/backup tasks.

                     Context.ContextState state)

                        boolean editable)

cleanupMetaGarbage

java.lang.String cleanupMetaGarbage()
Checks for contexts that have become empty, i.e. contexts for which meta information is present in the database that do not contain any triples. For all contexts satisfying the above condition, we delete the context meta information.

cleanupMetaGarbage

java.lang.String cleanupMetaGarbage(java.util.Set<org.openrdf.model.URI> contexts)
Checks for contexts that have become empty within the specified set of context identifiers, i.e. contexts for which meta information is present in the database that do not contain any triples. For all contexts satisfying the above condition, we delete the context meta information.

calculateVoIDStatistics

void calculateVoIDStatistics(org.openrdf.model.URI context)
Calculates VoID (Vocabulary of Interlinked Datasets) statistics for a given URI. Can be invoked whenever a context is created or updated and statistics shall be calculated automatically without the user being required to do so via the UI (VoIDWidget).

Whenever this method is invoked, it first checks, whether there are already VoID statistics present for the given resource. If so, these statistics are deleted. Afterwards the statistics themselves are calculated.

Theoretically this method could be invoked using any valid URI, however for the time being it should only be used with a valid context (rdf:type System:Context) or null. Reason being if the resource is deleted currently the VoID statistics persist.

Parameters:
context - The context of which VoID statistics are to be calculated. If set to null statistics of the complete repository are calculated.

startTransaction

boolean startTransaction()
Starts a transaction if not already started.

Returns:
true if a new transaction was started, false otherwise.

rollbackTransaction

void rollbackTransaction()

finishTransaction

void finishTransaction(boolean started)
Finishes a transaction by commiting if started flag is set. Otherwise the method has no effect.
